intro: Tithymalus adenochlorus, commonly known as the narrowleaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinctive silvery-green coloration. The small, yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family.
